data.title: Guidance on WhatsApp Media Messages
data.meta_description: Guidance for content-type and media file size limits. Send media messages in WhatsApp using the Twilio API for WhatsApp.
data.text:
With the Twilio API for WhatsApp, you can send images, video, text, and PDF files to create rich contextual conversations with your WhatsApp Users. This guide covers guidelines to follow when sending and receiving media messages through WhatsApp to ensure a smooth experience with your customers.

Media Content Types

media-content-types page anchor

To send a WhatsApp media message, you must specify the MediaUrl parameter when making a request to the Twilio API for WhatsApp. Twilio checks the content-type header at the provided MediaUrl to validate the content type(link takes you to an external page) of the media file. If the content-type header does not match that of the media file, Twilio rejects the request.

Message Size Limits

message-size-limits page anchor

When you send an outbound WhatsApp message, the total message size must be under the maximum size limit for the channel. An API request with media or a collection of media larger than the size limit will fail with an error.

For a WhatsApp message, the maximum size limit is 16MB. Please note that the size limit for images is only 5 MB.

Filenames and Captions

filenames-and-captions page anchor

Currently, Twilio does not support setting a filename or caption for documents that are send as media messages over WhatsApp.

Supported MIME Types

supported-mime-types page anchor

The Twilio API for WhatsApp supports sending and receiving images, audio, PDF files, and video. The following formats are currently supported:

Images: JPG, JPEG, PNG, WEBP*

Audio: OGG**, AMR, 3GP, AAC, MPEG

Documents: PDF, DOC, DOCX, PPTX, XLSX

Video: MP4 (with H.264 video codec and AAC audio)

Contacts: vCard (.vcf)

* Please note the following:

*The image/webp MIME type is only used for WhatsApp stickers, which have additional requirements. See support article(link takes you to an external page) for more details.

**WhatsApp outbound OGG is only supported when the OGG file uses the opus audio codec. These files may have the .ogg or the .opus extension.
